data.title: Montedison Names President
data.meta_description: Giuseppe Medici named pres; succeeds Eugenio Cefis (S)
data.text:

Montedison Names President

July 15, 1977

See the article in its original context from

July 15, 1977 , Page 70Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

About the Archive

This is a digitized version of an article from The Times’s print archive, before the start of online publication in 1996. To preserve these articles as they originally appeared, The Times does not alter, edit or update them.

Occasionally the digitization process introduces transcription errors or other problems; we are continuing to work to improve these archived versions.

ROME, July 14 (AP)—Giuseppe Medici, 70 years old, who was 12 times a cabinet minister in Italian governments and a member of the Christian Democrat party, was named president of Montedison SPA, Italy's largest chemical concern, the company announced today. Medici, a former professor of economics at the University of Perugia, succeeds Eugenio Cefis who resigned April 14.
